shared
Class AddressBook

java.lang.Object
  shared.AddressBook
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class AddressBook
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

An AddressBook provides functionality for working with a virtual address book of guests, implemented as a vector of GuestInfo objects. Note that duplicate guests are not permitted in the address book, where two guests are considered duplicates if they share the same ID.

See Also:
Serialized Form

load

public void load(java.io.File loadFile)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Loads an address book from a binary file and assigns its GuestInfo Vector to this address book.

Parameters:
loadFile - the file to load the address book from
Throws:
java.io.IOException - for file not found, or error with input stream
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - for bad input file

importGuestInfos

public void importGuestInfos(java.io.File importFile,
                             java.lang.String recordDelimRegex,
                             java.lang.String fieldDelimRegex)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Imports either new guests from an existing text file and adds them (if they are unique) to this AddressBook.

Parameters:
importFile - the file to load the new guests from
recordDelimRegex - the regex to split the file contents on, to get the separate guest records
fieldDelimRegex - the regex to split the records on, to get the separate fields for a guest
Throws:
java.io.IOException
